ibis.compile

Class IbiscComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.compile.IbiscComponent

  • public abstract class IbiscComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class must be implemented by all components that are to be part of the Ibis compiler framework, and is the only means through which the Ibis compiler framework communicates with the component.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean fromIbisc
      Set when instantiated from Ibisc.
      protected boolean keep
      Keep generated Java files around.
      protected boolean verbose
      Verbose flag.
      protected ByteCodeWrapper wrapper
      Wrapper for specific bytecode rewriter implementation.

      Compiles the specified list of arguments, which are all derived from the specified class.

      Returns the name of the directory in which the file was found from which the class indicated by the specified class name was read.

      This method returns a short string, usable for a "usage" message when the user passes wrong parameters to ibisc.

      This method processes an iterator which delivers java classes.

      This method accepts an array of program arguments, processes the arguments that are intended for this component, and removes these arguments from the list.

      Returns the rewriter implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IbiscComponent

    • Method Detail

      • processArgs

        public abstract boolean processArgs(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> args)
        This method accepts an array of program arguments, processes the arguments that are intended for this component, and removes these arguments from the list. The parameter array may/must be modified.
        Parameters:
        args - the array of program arguments.
        Returns:
        true when this component must be run, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - may be thrown when there was an error in the arguments.

      • getUsageString

        public abstract java.lang.String getUsageString()
        This method returns a short string, usable for a "usage" message when the user passes wrong parameters to ibisc.
        Returns:
        a usage string.

      • process

        public abstract void process(java.util.Iterator<?> classes)
        This method processes an iterator which delivers java classes. The values are classes as represented by the byte code rewriter used. The component processes these entries as it sees fit. It can add entries by means of the addEntry(ClassInfo cl, String fromClass) method.
        Parameters:
        classes - the class iterator to process.

      • rewriterImpl

        public abstract java.lang.String rewriterImpl()
        Returns the rewriter implementation. ASM and BCEL are supported.
        Returns:
        the rewriter implementation needed/used by this IbiscComponent.

      • getDirectory

        protected java.lang.String getDirectory(java.lang.String cl)
        Returns the name of the directory in which the file was found from which the class indicated by the specified class name was read. Returns null if the class is not found or the file lived in the current directory.
        Parameters:
        cl - the classname.
        Returns:
        the directory name or null.

      • writeAll

        protected void writeAll()
        Writes out all modified classes and jars.

      • setModified

        protected void setModified(ClassInfo cl)
        Notifies that the specified class has changed.
        Parameters:
        cl - the class that has changed.

      • addEntry

        protected void addEntry(ClassInfo cl,
                        java.lang.String fromClass)
        Adds a new entry to the class list. The new entry is derived from the specified class, and is ultimately written in the same directory, or the same jar file as the class from which it is derived.
        Parameters:
        cl - the new entry.
        fromClass - the name of the class from which it is derived.

      • compile

        protected void compile(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> args,
                       java.lang.String fromClass)
        Compiles the specified list of arguments, which are all derived from the specified class. The resulting classes are ultimately written in the same directory or the same jar file as the class from which they are derived.
        Parameters:
        args - the list of Java files to compile.
        fromClass - the name of the class from which they are derived.
